issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
1) Launch KitchenSink
2) Open Phone -> Play Movie -> Local

Results: 
Runtime error.
Location: [31,0]app://examples/movie_local.js
Message:
Wrapped java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Expected org.appcelerator.titanium.proxy.TiViewProxy type for argument "child" in "add", but got [Ti.Media.VideoPlayer] (app://examples//movie_local.js#31)

Notes: 
This seems to be a Android 4.0 issue only.  I tested it on the same emulator with Google API's Android 2.3.3 and a Nexus One 2.2.2 where the video played normally.
fields.summary: Android: KS - Playing a local movie causes a runtime error
fields.environment: Android emulator (Google API's Android 4.0, HVGA Screen), SDK 1.8.0.v20111018155412, Ubuntu 11.04

comments.body: Resolving ticket as invalid as this version of Kitchen Sink is no longer supported.
